quotes.quote: A clean pig makes lean bacon.
A pig may whistle, though it has a bad mouth for it.
A pig used to dirt turns its nose up at rice.
A pig's tail will never make a good arrow.
Child's pig, father's pork.
He that has but one pig easily fattens it.
If you catch a pig, catch it by the leg.
If you pull one pig by the tail all the rest will squeal.
Old pigs have hard snouts.
Pigs are smart little creatures. They just need love.
Today's pig is tomorrows bacon!
I will never deny that life isn't fair. It seems as though when a woman leaves a man she is strong and independent, but when a man leaves a woman he is a pig and a jerk.
A pig resembles a saint in that he is more honored after death than during his lifetime.
You can put wings on a pig, but you don't make it an eagle.
You can't fatten the pig on market day.
Never try to teach a pig to sing. You waste your time and you annoy the pig.
Well-being and happiness never appeared to me as an absolute aim. I am even inclined to compare such moral aims to the ambitions of a pig.
Never try to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and it annoys the pig.
Man thrives where angels would die of ecstasy and where pigs would die of disgust.
Pigs prefer to wallow in clean mud, but if nothing else is available, they will frequently wallow in their own urine, giving rise to the notion that they are dirty animals.
The best pears fall into pigs' mouth.
The life of a pig is short and sweet.
The worst pig often gets the best pear.
To sheer a pig is to cause a great commotion over very little wool.
To wash a pig is to waste both water and soap.
What can you expect from a pig but a grunt?
When the pig has had a bellyful it upsets the trough.
Whether you ignore a pig or worship that pig from afar, to the pig it's all the same.
A dead pig is not afraid of boiling water.
A pig washes in the first pool of water he encounters.
